frameDefinitions: A Speaker uses language to affirm or deny the truth of a Message to some Addressee.
An Agent or Cause makes a New_member part of  Group.
An Inspector attains a degree of certainty in the Unconfirmed_content, generally by inspecting some evidence.
In this frame, which is a  part of the Trial sequence, a Judge gives a Finding with respect to the Charges against the Defendant in a particular Case.
A Ratifier responds to a Proposal constructed by another party to make it binding over the Ratifier's jurisdiction or constituency.
Some Protection prevents a Danger from harming an Asset.
frameExamples: She <t>affirmed</t> her loyalty to the cause.
I <t>added</t> a new rock to my collection.
He was <t>convicted</t> of fraud by Judge Judy.
The <t>ratification</t> of the Kyoto protocol has been a long, hard slog.
The rubber on her sneakers <t>protected</t> her from the mud.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity affirming or denying the truth of the <fen>Message</fen> (this can be spoken or written). It is normally expressed as the External Argument of the predicative uses of the target word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun.
The <fen>Message</fen> identifies the content whose truth the <fen>Speaker</fen> is affirming or denying. It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is rarely mentioned in constructions with verbal targets, and is much more common with nominal targets, where it is usually expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'of' or about'.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied.
<fen>Place</fen> specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is a volitional animate being who causes the <fen>New_member</fen> to become part of the <fen>Group</fen>.
Something that is already a member of the <fen>Group</fen> and represents the <fen>Group</fen> as a whole.
An item that becomes a part of the <fen>Group</fen>.

The <fen>Group</fen> is anything that can be conceptualized as a complex collection of parts or ingredients, including through metonymy like containers or locations, which <fen>New_member</fen>s can join.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that is responsible for causing a <fen>New_member</fen> to enter a <fen>Group</fen>.
This role identifies when the inclusion of the <fen>New_member</fen> to the <fen>Group</fen> occurs.
The location in which a <fen>New_member</fen> is entered into a pre-existing <fen>Group</fen>.
The individual or individuals that ascertain that the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen> is true.
An open proposition that the <fen>Inspector</fen> decides by examining evidence.  It is usually a propostion put forward which some parties would disbelieve or contest.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Inspector</fen> verifies the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen>:
This role describes the <fen>Time</fen> at which the verification event takes place.
This role describes where the verificiation event takes place.
The <fen>Judge</fen> (which may be the jury, judge, magistrate or court) decides on the <fen>Finding</fen>.
This role identifies the outcome of the <fen>Judge</fen>'s deliberation or consideration. Many LUs in this frame incorporate this FE.
The person who stands accused of a crime and is subject to the verdict.
This role refers to the <fen>Charges</fen> with respect to which the verdict is being given.
The <fen>Case</fen> on which the verdict is being given.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.

The individual or body that confirms a Proposal negotiated or created by another party, causing it to become binding in a jurisdiction represented by the <fen>Ratifier</fen>.  In the case of direct democratic ratification, the jurisdiction and the <fen>Ratifier</fen> are the same.
The idea or course of action proposed by another individual or body which the <fen>Ratifier</fen> endorses and makes binding.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Ratifier</fen> makes the <fen>Proposal</fen> binding.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Ratifier</fen> ratifies the <fen>Proposal</fen>.
The person, entity, or action that prevents harm to an <fen>Asset</fen>.
A situation that could damage the <fen>Asset</fen>.
Something desirable possessed by or directly associated with the <fen>Protection</fen> which might be lost or damaged.
The time when the <fen>Danger</fen> threatens.
The place where the <fen>Danger</fen> threatened the <fen>Asset</fen>.
listRoleExamples: No one believed <fex>Evelyn</fex>'s affirmation that she could speak to ghosts.
They refute the criticisms <fex>that they are only interested in power and money</fex>.
<fex>Matt</fex> seems to add new work to his flickr most days.
The companyincludes philanthropic endeavors in their accomplishments
<fex>The calls of crows</fex> added an eerie aspect to the atmosphere of our date.
<fex>His</fex> later verification of the facts is certainly beyond reproach.
It is extremely difficult to confirm <fex>the absence of something</fex>.
<fex>Chapter four</fex> confirms the reader 's suspicions completely.
If <fex>we</fex> ratify Management 's plan , we 'll have to take a drug test every week !
President Aleksander Kwasniewski ratified <fex>protocols to the Europol Convention</fex>.
<fex>The tabloid's deal with the woman</fex> shielded Schwarzenegger.

Other nations tended to muffle or modulate their occasional annoyance with the
country that was their shield <fex>against the Soviet threat</fex>.
Almost 10 years later, that agreement insulated <fex>Microsoft</fex> from liability on copyright claims over the graphical user interface (GUI).
Regardless of the distribution media, USPTO information is safeguarded <fex>before, during, and after dissemination</fex> from improper access and modification.
To make his way on a foreign soil, he needed different guardians from those that protected him <fex>in his own birthplace</fex> .

sourceCandidateSpans.text: section 125A of the Representation of the People Act
